identificationModule.briefTitle: Comparison of Two Salpingectomy Techniques for Sterilization at the Time of Cesarean Delivery
identificationModule.officialTitle: Comparison of Two Salpingectomy Techniques for Sterilization at the Time of Cesarean Delivery

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
One in three women of reproductive age utilize tubal sterilization for contraception, and sterilization is often requested at time of cesarean delivery. Complete salpingectomy for the purpose of permanent sterilization at the time of cesarean birth is increasingly being performed worldwide.

A preferred complete salpingectomy technique for the purpose of sterilization at the time of cesarean delivery has not emerged in current practice. The objective is to compare short-term clinical outcomes and cost of salpingectomy using a hand-held bipolar energy instrument with those of traditional suture ligation. This retrospective cohort study will be conducted from 2017-2023 at a single tertiary care hospital. The investigators hypothesize that bipolar energy instrument use will not significantly improve clinical outcomes.

armGroups.label: Complete salpingectomy using a hand-held bipolar energy instrument
Complete salpingectomy using traditional suture ligation

interventions.name: Hand-held bipolar energy instrument
interventions.description: A bipolar energy instrument is used for complete salpingectomy at the time of cesarean delivery.
armGroupLabels: Complete salpingectomy using a hand-held bipolar energy instrument

interventions.name: Traditional suture ligation
interventions.description: Traditional suture ligation technique is used for complete salpingectomy at the time of cesarean delivery.
armGroupLabels: Complete salpingectomy using traditional suture ligation

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Hemoglobin levels on postoperative day one
primaryOutcomes.description: Change in hemoglobin levels reported in gram per deciliter on postoperative day one, calculated as the difference between immediate preoperative and postoperative day 1 hemoglobin levels
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: preoperatively and one day after surgery

secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of sterilization procedure completed by postoperative day one
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: preoperatively and one day after surgery

secondaryOutcomes.description: estimated blood loss calculated and documented in milliliters at the end of the procedure
Rate of injury to abdominal/pelvic organs sustained during the procedure
any need for blood products transfusion intraoperatively through discharge
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from day of surgery up to 30 days pospartum

secondaryOutcomes.description: time necessary to complete the surgery from skin incision to end of skin closure
any admission to the intensive care unit for procedure-related complications
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from day of surgery up to 7 days postpartum

secondaryOutcomes.description: Duration of hospitalization in days from admission to discharge
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from day of surgery up to 6 weeks postpartum

secondaryOutcomes.description: Any admission after initial discharge from the hospital
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Day of initial dischage through 6 weeks postpartum

secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of participants who return to the operating room due to initial procedure-related complications
pain severity measured on a scale of 0 through 10
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from day of surgery up to 7 days postparum

secondaryOutcomes.description: any infection that occurs post-surgery in the abdomen, pelvis, abdominal walls or skin
cost difference between bipolar instrument and suture

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* request for permanent sterilization at the time of cesarean delivery
* 24 weeks' gestation or beyond
* 21 years old or older
* Medicaid sterilization consent per Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services regulations (if Medicaid recipient).

Exclusion Criteria:

* vaginal delivery
* history of prior adnexal surgery (such as prior bilateral tubal ligation or unilateral salpingectomy oophorectomy)
* placenta accreta spectrum
* placenta previa
* history of bleeding diathesis.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients aged 21 years or older undergoing permanent sterilization at the time of cesarean delivery at 24 weeks' gestation or beyond, 21 years old and older
